properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-21T03:38:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-20T11:38:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4096758718.2020
Area: Kuujjuarapik

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A disturbance developing over the Davis Strait is expected to intensify over the weekend bringing snow and strong northwesterly winds to Clyde River. Winds are forecast to increasing late Saturday night and remain strong on Sunday resulting in blizzard or near blizzard conditions. Winds will diminish slightly on Monday with visibilities gradually improving. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-21T12:23:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-20T20:24:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0581754592.2020
Area: Clyde River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Stagnant winter weather conditions are creating elevated pollution levels. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-11-21T15:44:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-11-20T23:44:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1911327308.2020
Area: Yellowhead
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm continues. A moist and unstable airmass will continue to give flurries to the Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt route today and tonight. Brief periods of heavier snow are likely again resulting in further accumulations of up to 15 cm near the summit by early Saturday morning. The snow level is currently near 1100 metres and is expected to drop to below 600 overnight. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-21T11:25:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-20T19:26:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3237127468.2020
Area: Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Possible significant snowfall on Sunday. A developing low pressure system over the American Midwest will affect Southwestern Quebec beginning Sunday afternoon. This system will intensify as it approaches the province. Depending on its track, which is still uncertain, this low pressure system could give significant snowfall amounts and cause strong winds over Southern and Central Quebec Sunday night, especially over regions along the northern banks of the St-Lawrence River. It will then spread to eastern Quebec on Monday. If the expected track remains the unchanged, precipitation is expected to begin as snow, then gradually change to rain with a risk of freezing rain during the changeover on Monday morning over most areas. Future weather statements will provide more details as the low pressure system's track as well as precipitation types and amounts become more certain. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-21T12:50:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-20T20:51:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0717751457.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 20 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system approaching the North Coast on Saturday will bring heavy snow near Stewart. The heavy snow will begin Saturday morning and will end on Saturday evening. Snowfall amounts of 20 cm are expected by midnight on Saturday night. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-21T15:47:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-20T23:48:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4175228272.2020
Area: North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada
